intro: Costus productus var. strigosus, commonly known as the hairy costus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and related plants. The plant features tall, slender stems with broad, lance-shaped leaves that have a hairy texture. Its inflorescence consists of clusters of small, pale yellow to greenish-white flowers. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soil and full sun.
